name: enumerator_num
label::English: 1.1. Please record your enumerator number
hint::English: To be filled in by enumerator

name: enumerator_gender
label::English: 1.1.2. Please record your gender

name: governorate_wash
label::English: 1.2.1. Current Governorate
hint::English: To be filled in by enumerator

name: cluster_location_id
label::English: 1.2.2. What is the ID number of your Location?
hint::English: To be filled in by enumerator

name: hhh
label::English: 1.3.1. Are you the head of household?
hint::English: A household is a group of people who regularly share meals, income, and expenditures together. Members must acknowledge the authority of one person as head of household and that person must actually live with the rest of the household members. In polygamous households, each wife is treated as a distinct household when the wives live in different houses, cook separately and take decisions independently.

name: will_to_response
label::English: 1.3.2.  If no, are you willing and able to respond to the questions on behalf of the household?

name: consent
label::English: 1.3.3.  Hello, my name is __ and I work for REACH initiative. We are conducting interviews in order to inform the humanitarian response in Iraq. This interview will take around 45 minutes,  and your answers will remain anonymous and you are free to withdraw at any moment during the survey. The information you provide us will be used in reports and factsheets and shared with humanitarian decision-makers in Iraq. Do you agree to participate?

name: age_respondent
label::English: 1.4.. What is your age?
constraint_message:English: Age cannot be below 18 and above 120

name: gender_respondent
label::English: 1.5. Respondent's sex

name: household_number
label::English: 1.7. How many people are currently living in this household?

name: household_member_male_18
label::English: 1.8.1. How many of the household members are male 18+?

name: household_member_female_18
label::English: 1.8.2. How many of the household members are female 18+?

name: household_member_male_under18
label::English: 1.8.3. How many of the household members are male under 18?

name: household_member_female_under18
label::English: 1.8.4. How many of the household members are female under 18?
constraint_message:English: Answer must be the same as total number of household members

name: source_income
label::English: 1.6.1. What is your households most common source of income?

name: employment_respondent
label::English: 1.6.2. Is anyone in the household earning an income through employment(formal or informal)?

name: sector_respondent
label::English: 1.6.3. What sector does the highest earner work in?

name: sector_respondent_other
label::English: If other, please specify

name: income_respondent
label::English: 1.6.4.  What is your households average monthly income? (IQD)

name: household_profile
label::English: Household Profile

name: displace_Status
label::English: Was your household living in this subdistrict prior to January 2014?

name: displace_Status_returnee
label::English: Have you been displaced from this sub-district since January 2014?

name: note_returnee
label::English: This household is a returnee household.

name: note_nondisplaced
label::English: This household is non-displaced.

name: Displace_Status_idp
label::English: Did you move to this subdistrict because of the conflict?

name: note_IDP
label::English: This household is an IDP household.

name: reasons_return
label::English: What were the main reasons behind your decision to return?

name: displace_date_returnee
label::English: When were you initially displaced from your sub-district?

name: displace_date_idp
label::English: When were you initially displaced from your sub-district?

name: return_date_returnee
label::English: When did you return to this subdistrict after your most recent incidence of displacement?

name: arrival_date_idp
label::English: When did you arrive to this current location?

name: idp_first_place
label::English: Is this location your first place of displacement?
hint::English: Place of displacement should not include transit areas. Displacement implies settling down somewhere.

name: governorate_origin
label::English: What governorate in Iraq were you living in before your displacement (forced to leave your home)?

name: district_origin
label::English: What district in Iraq were you living in before your displacement?

name: water
label::English: Water

name: drinking_water_source
label::English: 3.1.1. What has been your household's primary source of drinking water over the past 30 days?

name: drinking_water_source_other
label::English: If other, please specify

name: secondary_water_source
label::English: 3.1.2. Aside from this main source, does your household use other sources of water for drinking? If yes, which ones?

name: secondary_drinking_water_source_other
label::English: If other, please specify

name: cooking_water_source
label::English: 3.1.3. What has been your household's sources of water for cooking, washing and cleaning in the last 30 days?

name: nondrinking_water_source_other
label::English: If other, please specify

name: bottled_water
label::English: 3.1.4. Do you purchase bottled water?

name: bottled_water_price
label::English: 3.1.5. How much do you spend on bottled water a week (IQD)?

name: access_private_shared_watertank
label::English: 3.2.1. Does your household own either a private or shared water tank?

name: capacity_watertank
label::English: 3.2.2. Please can you show me where you store water? Evaluate the capacity of the containers.
hint::English: Provide an estimate, if the respondend doesn't know input "999"

name: people_share_tank
label::English: 3.2.3. How many people share this water tank?
hint::English: Provide an estimate, if the respondend doesn't know input "999"

name: refill_times
label::English: 3.2.4. How many times do you re-fill your tanks each week?
hint::English: Provide an estimate, if the respondend doesn't know input "999"

name: safety_watertank
label::English: 3.2.5. Is the water in the tank stored safely?
hint::English: Storage with a clean cover and has a tap to take water from.

name: sufficient_access
label::English: 3.3. Overall, has your households access to water been enough to meet or satisfy the basic needs of your household members in the last 30 days?

name: problems_access_reasons
label::English: 3.4. What problems do you have in accessing water?

name: problems_access_reasons_other
label::English: If other, please specify

name: water_access_problems_exclnoproblems
label::English: 3.4. What problems do you have in accessing water?

name: water_needs
label::English: 3.5. In the last 30 days, did you and your household members have enough water to meet the following needs? (select all that apply)

name: water_contingency
label::English: 3.7. In the last 7 days, have you or any of your family members:

name: water_contingency_exclnone
label::English: 3.7. In the last 7 days, have you or any of your family members:

name: waterpoint_time
label::English: 3.8.1. How long does it take to go to your main water point, fetch water, and return (at peak time)?

name: waterfetching_problem
label::English: 3.8.2. If no water on premises, do you feel the activity of fetching water (distance and/or queuing time) constitutes a problem for your household?

name: problems_associated
label::English: 3.8.3. If relevant, what are the problems associated with fetching water?
hint::English: (Select all that apply but do not read choices)

name: problems_associated_other
label::English: If other, please specify

name: shortages_water_point
label::English: 3.8.4. Has your HH experienced water shortages from water points?

name: total_shortages_water_point
label::English: 3.8.5. How many times did your household experience water shortages in the last 7 days?

name: waterpoint_functional
label::English: 3.8.6. If applicable, is the waterpoint closest to the household functional?

name: waterpoint_leakeges
label::English: 3.8.7. Does the waterpipe network in the vicinity of this water point show any leakeges?

name: treat_water
label::English: 3.9.1. Does your household treat the water in any way to make it safer to drink?

name: treat_techniques
label::English: 3.9.2. What does your household usually do to make water safer to drink?

name: treat_techniques_other
label::English: If other, please specify

name: why_free_techniques
label::English: 3.9.3. If using free methods (stand and settle, boil, expose to sunlight), why do you use this method?
relevant: selected(${problems_associated},'Let it stand and settle') or selected(${problems_associated}, 'Boil it') or selected(${problems_associated},'Expose it to sunlight')

name: why_free_techniques_other
label::English: If other, please specify

name: why_treat
label::English: 3.9.4. Why do you feel the need to treat it?

name: why_treat_other
label::English: If other, please specify

name: consulted_facilities
label::English: 3.9.5. Was anyone from your household consulted at the time of design and siting of water facilities?

name: female_consulted_facilities
label::English: If yes, were any female members of your household consulted?

name: satisfied_water
label::English: 3.9.6. How satisfied is your household with regards to access to water?

name: sanitation
label::English: Sanitation

name: sanitation_facility

label::English: If other, please specify

name: share_facility
label::English: 4.1.2. Do you share this sanitation facility with other households?
relevant: not(selected(${sanitation_facility},'None of the above')) or not(selected(${sanitation_facility},'open defecation'))

relevant: not(selected(${sanitation_facility},'None of the above')) or not(selected(${sanitation_facility},'open defecation'))

name: toilet_responsible
label::English: 4.1.5. Who is responsible for maintaining it in your household?

name: access_sanitation_other
label::English: If other, please specify

name: latrine_facility

relevant: not(selected(${sanitation_facility},'None of the above')) or not(selected(${sanitation_facility},'open defecation'))
